result.execSummary:
The defendant Varnell Taylor Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Straight Time. Sentence credit of 152 Days were granted if imposed.

miscConds.notes: Restitution for Lisa to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 04/01/2015 as a condition of probation.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation after restitution is paid.

No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions and sign any medical releases.

No Contact with co-defendants, victim and the address on Hillsdale Drive East or it's residents. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Obtain a valid license within 60 days. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Straight Time. STAYED for use at agent's discretion.
Perform 20 Hours community service for EACH YEAR of probation with the 20 hours for the second year to be completed by 12/15/16.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

Defendant Varnell Taylor in court, in custody, with attorney Robert J. Penegor.   Sue Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer MIchael Anderson from the City of Brookfield Police Department, sworn and testified. Cross examination. State rests. No testimony provided by the defense. State provides closing statements and moves for bind over. Atty. Penegor provides closing statements and objects to bind over.   Court find probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Atty. Penegor makes a Motion to Modify bail. State objects to any modification. Court denies any modification.   Bail remains as fixed.
